iterations.diagnosis: The search is failing completely with 0% precision and recall. The main issues are: 1) The _build_search_patterns function creates patterns that may not match actual file structures, 2) The keyword extraction is too restrictive, requiring words >2 characters and filtering too aggressively, 3) The file limit of 100 in _search_for_keywords is too low for large codebases. The search needs to be more inclusive initially.

The current implementation uses overly generic patterns and doesn't leverage common codebase conventions. It treats all files equally without prioritizing source files over tests/docs, and doesn't utilize directory naming patterns that typically indicate product areas.

The search is missing service-layer files because: 1) Service patterns are buried among too many generic patterns, 2) Keyword extraction ignores the actual issue content which contains important domain terms like 'pins', 'bill', 'subscription', and 3) Path prioritization doesn't rank service files high enough.

patterns_tried.description: Add more inclusive base patterns to ensure we find files even when product_area/component are vague
Increase file search limit from 100 to 500 to improve coverage
Make keyword extraction less restrictive to catch more relevant terms
Add source-focused patterns that prioritize src/, app/, lib/ directories and exclude test/docs by default
Add service/module naming patterns that follow common conventions like user_service.py, auth_handler.py
Prioritize files based on path importance (src > lib > tests) and filter obvious non-source files
Move service-specific patterns to the beginning for higher priority
Add extraction of domain terms from issue content if available
Increase priority for service and api directories in path scoring
